sentences.en: At last she went early to bed, more and more indisposed.
sentences.cn: 她终于早早上床, 越来越感到不好过.

sentences.en: Contact with realities indisposed him to any more idle speculations.
sentences.cn: 接触实际使他不再倾向于无益的空想.

sentences.en: He is indisposed to join the mobile medical team.
sentences.cn: 他不想参加巡回医疗队.

sentences.en: I am [ feel ] indisposed for any work.
sentences.cn: 我对任何工作都不 感 兴趣.

sentences.en: I am indisposed with a cold.
sentences.cn: 我因为伤风感到不舒服.

sentences.en: I am indisposed with a headache.
Mary is indisposed with fever; her part will be played by Shirley.
sentences.cn: 玛丽因病(发烧)而不能演出, 她的角色改由莎莉主演.

sentences.en: She has a headache and is rather indisposed.
She is indisposed with a headache.
She seems indisposed to play tennis.
She was indisposed to help us.
She was very much indisposed to go to that dirty place.
sentences.cn: 她根本不想去那个脏地方.

sentences.en: Shirley will also stand in for an indisposed singer.
sentences.cn: 莎莉亦将代替另一名因病不能演出的歌手.
很遗憾，演讲人身体不适。

words.tran_cn: 使不适当；使厌恶；使不舒服

trans.tran_cn: 不舒服的，有病的，不愿的，不乐意的
trans.tran_en: If you say that someone is indisposed, you mean that they are not available because they are ill, or for a reason that you do not want to reveal

trans.tran_cn: 厌恶( indispose的过去式和过去分词 )
